title: Mother had two cosmetic surgeries at the same time 'because it was cheaper' before dying days later
text:
The mother of a beauty therapist who died following breast enlargement and tummy tuck surgery said her daughter was advised she could have both procedures "at the same time as it would be cheaper".

Louise Harvey, 36, of Norwich, died on July 5 2018 after undergoing the operations in London on June 17 2018.

Her mother Linda Harvey, 53, told the inquest that her daughter asked to see her sons the day before she passed away.

A post-mortem examination recorded that the mother of three died of a bilateral pulmonary embolism, a blood clot that occurs in the lungs. Secondary causes were recorded as breast augmentation and abdominoplasty, the medical term for a tummy tuck.

According to Miss Harvey’s mother, her family had a history of blood clots. In Monday’s inquest in Norwich, she said that her daughter was sent home without blood thinners.

In a statement read by Norfolk's area coroner Yvonne Blake, Linda Harvey said that her daughter wanted a tummy tuck as "she felt she had some loose skin around her belly following the birth of her youngest son".

She said Miss Harvey spoke with someone at the clinic and "they suggested having (the two operations) at the same time as it would be cheaper".
